item.title: HackTheBox - Beep
item.author: Author
item.description: Set up First I create a working directory: 1 2 3 ❯ mkdir Beep ❯ cd !$ cd Beep Then I use the mk function that I have defined in my zsh configuration file, which I use to create my working directories: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 ❯ which mk mk () { mkdir {scans,content,loot,exploits,scripts,report} } ❯ mk ❯ ls  content  exploits  loot  report  scans  scripts Recon OS Fingerprinting This is the function that I have defined zsh configuration file .

item.title: Linux Privilege Escalation - Shared Object Injection
item.author: Author
item.description: Video Setting Up Install the required packages for this video: 1 low@ubuntu:~$ sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y vim gcc Now clear the screen: 1 low@ubuntu:~$ clear Let’s start by creating a working directory: 1 2 3 4 low@ubuntu:~$ mkdir so-files low@ubuntu:~$ cd !$ cd so-files low@ubuntu:~/so-files$ We’ll create a file named libcustom.c: 1 low@ubuntu:~/so-files$ vim libcustom.c This print a message and nothing more:

item.title: HackTheBox - Traverxec
item.author: Author
item.description:
Setup

As always, we need to have a comfortable space to work with so I’ll create my working directories with the mk function that I have defined in my Z shell:
